title: All Things Considered - BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition
description:
All Things Considered 
 BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition 
 Finley Gallery, Finley Hall 
 Exhibition dates: April 24-30, 2025 
 Closing Reception: Wednesday April 30, 6-8pm 
   
 Celebrate the end of the year with this brilliant showcase from our rising Visual Arts graduates! This exhibition marks the culmination of their degree, launching their creative journeys. Each student presents a cohesive body of artwork in the Finley Galleries, our final exhibition of the Fall 2025 semester. Join us on Wednesday, April 30 at 6pm to meet the artists at the closing reception. 
   
 All Things Considered  features an impressive range of interdisciplinary approaches: mixed-media sculpture, large-scale painting, hand-sewn textiles, ceramics, video projection, photography, and room-sized installations. 45 Visual Arts graduates invite you to explore their creative research and current concerns, on view through these vibrant capstone projects!  On view from April 24 till April 30, 2025.  
 Exhibiting Artists: Section 1: Santiago Arcila, Kelly Arita, Sabrina Gatti, Ian Hagen, Jiapsi Juarez-Cipriano, Bryana Martinez, Agnieszka Palka, Krisha Ravishankar, Jin Scheef, Anacia Sessoms, Walaa Shaabneh, Julea Sorrentino, Katie Weuste, Margo Wittlinger, Joseph Visco 
 Section 2: Jivon Batres, Nick Cruz, Genesis Garcia-Morales, Tevin Gomez, Lauryn Jeffrey, Bralen Jones, Aaron Leung, Emily Luh, Lara Maisonneuve, Gabriel Rodriguez, Amaya Tiozon, Sadie Vizcaino, Odessa Whitlock, Brenda Wilsea 
   
 Section 3: Frankie Christie, Paola Cruz, Gina DeMartino, Marlena Holston, Gabriel Marano, Jonathan Muruzumbay, Quara Phillips-Hill, Edward Puello, Meghan Sibert, Brion Spruill, Antonia Sussina, Kimberly Triana Vallejo, Grace Whitteaker, Zoe Yeung, Cedric Yoo, Claudia Zuraw

title: UGC Banquet
description: Come join the United Greek Coalition as we take some time to celebrate the accomplishments of all greek organizations under the UGC. There will be many laughs, food and memories. We will highlight individual Greek reps in their successes.

title: Hawk Hack 2025
location: Center for Environment and Life Sciences
description: Please Join us for a Hackathon hosted at the CELS! Sign up at our devpost below! https://hawkhack-2025.devpost.com/?ref_feature=challenge&ref_medium=your-open-hackathons&ref_content=Upcoming

title: Graduation Photos with Rocky the Red Hawk
description: Are you graduating this May and want to take a graduation photo with Rocky? Now is your chance! Rocky will be at the Hawk Statue by Cole Hall to pose with seniors before they flee the nest!

title: End of the Year Throwback Party
description:
🎉  End of the Year Throwback Party  🎶 Flashback to the best jams, styles, and memories of the year! 
 Let’s celebrate the end of the year with an epic  Throwback Party ! Grab your favorite retro outfit and get ready for an afternoon of nostalgic fun, great music, and unforgettable vibes. From throwback tunes to retro games, we’re bringing all the best moments from the year and beyond. 
 🎧 Throwback tunes  🎮 Retro activities 👗 Dress in your best retro style 🍕 Free snacks and throwback treats 
 All students are welcome, commuters need to be signed in with a resident following Residence Life guest registration procedures.

title: Knight of Wisdom
organization: Psi Sigma Phi Multicultural Fraternity, INC
description: This event aims to bring students together for a focused study sessions as they prepare for final exams. Helpful study tips will be shared and prizes will be given to motivate and encourage effective study habits and stress management.

title: Montclair State Car Club Semester Finale Car Show
description: In Collaboration with the William Paterson Car Club, Seton Hall Car Club, and 1OF1 Car Club, the Montclair State Car Club presents our Semester Finale Car Show! Tickets will be for sale via Eventbrite. All details will be announced on our Instagram page @montclairstate_carclub

title: UGC Banquet
description: A yearly celebration of the UGC!

title: Complexions Practice
description: Complexions will be have consistent practices to learn new choreography and prepare for any upcoming performance opportunities!

title: Group X - Goodnight Yoga
description:
A time to relax and de-stress from the week. In this class, students will be guided through movement, breathing, and meditation. This class will leave students feeling calm and ready to take on the week ahead of them through slow stretches and restorative postures. 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required. 
 FREE for students with a valid Montclair State ID 
 
 Where and When? 
 
 Every Sunday, from January 21 - April 27 
 7:00 - 7:45 pm  
 Student Recreation Center - Multipurpose Room 1 
 
 Instructor: CJ

 Let’s celebrate the end of the year with an epic  Throwback Party ! Grab your favorite retro outfit and get ready for an afternoon of nostalgic fun, great music, and unforgettable vibes. From throwback tunes to retro games, we’re bringing all the best moments from the year and beyond. 
 🎧 Throwback tunes  🎮 Retro activities 👗 Dress in your best retro style 🍕 Free snacks and throwback treats 
 All students are welcome, commuters need to be signed in with a resident following Residence Life guest registration procedures.

title: Knight of Wisdom
organization: Psi Sigma Phi Multicultural Fraternity, INC
description: This event aims to bring students together for a focused study sessions as they prepare for final exams. Helpful study tips will be shared and prizes will be given to motivate and encourage effective study habits and stress management.

title: Montclair State Car Club Semester Finale Car Show
description: In Collaboration with the William Paterson Car Club, Seton Hall Car Club, and 1OF1 Car Club, the Montclair State Car Club presents our Semester Finale Car Show! Tickets will be for sale via Eventbrite. All details will be announced on our Instagram page @montclairstate_carclub

title: UGC Banquet
description: A yearly celebration of the UGC!

title: Complexions Practice
description: Complexions will be have consistent practices to learn new choreography and prepare for any upcoming performance opportunities!

title: Group X - Goodnight Yoga
description:
A time to relax and de-stress from the week. In this class, students will be guided through movement, breathing, and meditation. This class will leave students feeling calm and ready to take on the week ahead of them through slow stretches and restorative postures. 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required. 
 FREE for students with a valid Montclair State ID 
 
 Where and When? 
 
 Every Sunday, from January 21 - April 27 
 7:00 - 7:45 pm  
 Student Recreation Center - Multipurpose Room 1 
 
 Instructor: CJ

title: All Things Considered - BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition
description:
All Things Considered 
 BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition 
 Finley Gallery, Finley Hall 
 Exhibition dates: April 24-30, 2025 
 Closing Reception: Wednesday April 30, 6-8pm 
   
 Celebrate the end of the year with this brilliant showcase from our rising Visual Arts graduates! This exhibition marks the culmination of their degree, launching their creative journeys. Each student presents a cohesive body of artwork in the Finley Galleries, our final exhibition of the Fall 2025 semester. Join us on Wednesday, April 30 at 6pm to meet the artists at the closing reception. 
   
 All Things Considered  features an impressive range of interdisciplinary approaches: mixed-media sculpture, large-scale painting, hand-sewn textiles, ceramics, video projection, photography, and room-sized installations. 45 Visual Arts graduates invite you to explore their creative research and current concerns, on view through these vibrant capstone projects!  On view from April 24 till April 30, 2025.  
 Exhibiting Artists: Section 1: Santiago Arcila, Kelly Arita, Sabrina Gatti, Ian Hagen, Jiapsi Juarez-Cipriano, Bryana Martinez, Agnieszka Palka, Krisha Ravishankar, Jin Scheef, Anacia Sessoms, Walaa Shaabneh, Julea Sorrentino, Katie Weuste, Margo Wittlinger, Joseph Visco 
 Section 2: Jivon Batres, Nick Cruz, Genesis Garcia-Morales, Tevin Gomez, Lauryn Jeffrey, Bralen Jones, Aaron Leung, Emily Luh, Lara Maisonneuve, Gabriel Rodriguez, Amaya Tiozon, Sadie Vizcaino, Odessa Whitlock, Brenda Wilsea 
   
 Section 3: Frankie Christie, Paola Cruz, Gina DeMartino, Marlena Holston, Gabriel Marano, Jonathan Muruzumbay, Quara Phillips-Hill, Edward Puello, Meghan Sibert, Brion Spruill, Antonia Sussina, Kimberly Triana Vallejo, Grace Whitteaker, Zoe Yeung, Cedric Yoo, Claudia Zuraw

title: UGC Banquet
description: Come join the United Greek Coalition as we take some time to celebrate the accomplishments of all greek organizations under the UGC. There will be many laughs, food and memories. We will highlight individual Greek reps in their successes.

title: Hawk Hack 2025
location: Center for Environment and Life Sciences
description: Please Join us for a Hackathon hosted at the CELS! Sign up at our devpost below! https://hawkhack-2025.devpost.com/?ref_feature=challenge&ref_medium=your-open-hackathons&ref_content=Upcoming

title: Graduation Photos with Rocky the Red Hawk
description: Are you graduating this May and want to take a graduation photo with Rocky? Now is your chance! Rocky will be at the Hawk Statue by Cole Hall to pose with seniors before they flee the nest!
